lead_paragraph: Experts on civil wars say there are several reasons Syria is “a really, really tough case” that defies historical parallels.

headline.print_headline: Why Syria’s War, After 400,000 Deaths, Is Only Getting Worse
headline.main: Syria’s Paradox: Why the War Only Ever Seems to Get Worse

snippet: Experts on civil wars say there are several reasons Syria is “a really, really tough case” that defies historical parallels....
abstract: Max Fisher The Interpreter column examines ongoing Syrian civil war, which after five years and 400,000 deaths, repels any attempt, including foreign interventions and peace talks, to resolve and stop it; experts say complexity of factors in Syria have made conflict nearly unparalleled in history of civil wars.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
